title: Stranded in Egypt, Palestinians from Gaza dream of returning home
subhed: Some 80,000 Palestinians fled Gaza for Egypt after the Hamas attacks on Israel on October 7, 2023, and the subsequent war launched in retaliation. Without refugee status, they cannot settle permanently in the country. With the announcement of the opening of the Rafah border crossing, many of them want to return to the enclave despite the destruction.

title: French MPs end budget deadlock after rejecting two no-confidence motions
Trump warns Iran of 'bad things' unless deal struck with US
Mark Carney, a prime minister seeking to free Canada from US dominance
subhed: As the international order recedes, the Canadian leader has moved on from the Trudeau era, when his predecessor was seen as naive on the world stage, in an effort to assert himself against hegemonic powers – starting with his American neighbor.

title: Clintons to testify in US House-led Epstein investigation
subhed: A spokesperson for the former US president said that Bill and Hillary Clinton will testify in an investigation surrounding Jeffrey Epstein, the sex offender who died in custody in 2019. "They look forward to setting a precedent that applies to everyone," he said.

title: At the Panthéon, artist Nicolas Daubanes turns to 10 sites of memory
subhed: With his striking suspended magnetic powder drawings, this history enthusiast evokes national sites marked by contemporary conflicts that have since become memorials.

title: Najannguaq Hegelund, Greenland's tireless activist for the Inuit cause
subhed: This 37-year-old woman, deeply involved in the nonprofit sector and a supporter of independence for the Danish autonomous territory, has established herself as one of the leading figures in the protests against Donald Trump's expansionist ambitions.

title: France demands €1.7 billion in payroll taxes from Uber, media report says

Two years after France introduced specialized units to combat domestic violence, results are mixed
subhed: The French Justice Ministry says most judicial and appeal courts have set up these units, which aim to provide a cross-disciplinary approach to handling domestic violence cases. On the ground, however, advocacy groups and lawyers remain cautious about the reform's impact.

title: Who's running in the Paris mayoral election?
subhed: Six main candidates are vying to succeed Mayor Anne Hidalgo, who is not running for re-election, in the municipal elections on March 15 and 22.
byline: By Manon Romain and Hélène Bekmezian

title: A bike journey across crisis-ridden Cuba under the watchful eye of state security
subhed: 'Cuba, an island adrift' (3/3). Le Monde reporters left Havana by bicycle to discover this country where people, under constant surveillance, have learned to survive through resourcefulness and the black market.

title: Environment: Europe's temptation to unravel hard-won progress, ignoring scientific truth
